snippet: A government panel called on the country to adopt a new legal interpretation of its war-renouncing Constitution that would permit an expanded role for its military.
abstract: Japanese government advisory panel, convened by Prime Min Shinzo Abe, calls for adoption of a new legal interpretation of its war-renouncing Constitution that would permit an expanded role for its military; Japan's armed forces have been strictly limited to protecting its own territory and people since World War II; proposed change would allow Japanese military to act in limited cases even when Japan is not at risk and to play a larger role in United Nations peacekeeping operations.
lead_paragraph: A government panel called on the country to adopt a new legal interpretation of its war-renouncing Constitution that would permit an expanded role for its military.

headline.main: Japan Moves to Scale Back Postwar Restrictions on the Use of Military Power
headline.print_headline: Japan Moves to Scale Back Postwar Restrictions on the Use of Military Power
